value.0: What do you want? You need to talk to Sedos to be initiated into the academy before I can offer you any sort of training.
It's about time you showed up, <FirstName>! My name is Herban, but as far as your worthless hide is concerned you can just call me Sir!
It's my job to teach you raw recruits some tips on combat technique so you maggots don't get gutted out there in the real world!
Well, recruit, don't just stand there with that dopey expression on your face! What's it going to be? Are you ready to handle some combat training or aren't you?
Maybe you think you don't need this kind of training, is that it? When you're staring down the point of some orc's crooked blade you'll wish you hadn't been such a smart ass!
Get out of here and don't come back until you're ready to learn, recruit!
Wrong answer, recruit! Everybody needs to learn how to handle themselves in a fight! So you better get ready for this training in a hurry!
You address me as Sir when you open your mouth, maggot! If this plague hadn't made us so desperate for recruits, I'd boot your worthless ass out of here for that type of attitude!
But I'm stuck with you and I don't have time to break your spirit and teach you proper respect and discipline. We don't have to like each other, but you will listen to what I have to say!
That's what I like to hear, recruit! With that attitude you might actually make something of yourself in this world!
This information might save your life sometime, recruit, so listen up...
Back again, recruit? What do you want this time? And you better address me as Sir or this conversation is over!
Then quit bothering me! I don't have time to be holding the hand of every kid who comes through the Academy. We're here to train you maggots, not babysit you!
You think that's funny, recruit? Well, I left my sense of humor dangling on the point of a blood encrusted Luskan spear thirty years ago, so don't waste your jokes on me!
Get out of my face, recruit! I'm sick of your wiseass ways!
Oh, you recruits are always full of questions, aren't you? Was the plague really started by an enemy of Neverwinter, Sir? Are the Waterdhavian creatures really here at the Academy, Sir?

Well, you better forget about those questions and focus on the here and now, recruit! Your ass belongs to the Academy until you step out those doors! The outside world is nothing to you. Do you hear me? NOTHING!
I expected as much - I guess if you can beat these two whippersnappers then there may be some hope for your sorry hide after all. Now I guess you'll be expecting something for completing the trials.

Well, today's your lucky day. A former student didn't bother to clean up after they have left. Now we're stuck with their junk. I was going to give them to Olgerd to auction off but I'll let you deal with it. Saves me the burden of walking to the Core.
I guess that's it then. See you around, recruit.
You're sure? You have a good heart, recruit. See you around.
<StartCheck>[Failure]</Start> You don't scare me, recruit. Now get out of my face before I make you start doing pacers!
<StartCheck>[Success]</Start> There's no need for that! Now take the rest of it and get going.
<StartCheck>[Failure]</Start> Where'd you hear that from, recruit? You're lying. I don't have time for liars. Off with you.

<StartCheck>[Success]</Start> Bah, I've been getting too many complaints lately. I especially can't get a complaint from a student that Aribeth personally enrolled. Alright, take this and get out of my face.
<StartCheck>[Failure]</Start> Nope, that's it. See you around, recruit.
<StartCheck>[Success]</Start> Now that you mention it... Go ahead and have this too. See you around, recruit.
I don't have time for this nonsense.
Sir, no Sir! I'm not ready yet, Sir!
What's with all the shouting? Is this supposed to inspire me or something?
All right, let's get this over with.
Sir! I'm ready, Sir!
I think I'll be going now, Sir.
I'm tired of calling you Sir. How about we compromise and I call you Shirley?
I want to ask you some questions, Sir.
I'd like to continue my combat training, Sir!
I have completed my combat trials. What now, sir?
Thank you, Sir.
I appreciate the gesture, Sir, but I can't accept this. The academy needs all the funds it can get.
<StartCheck>[Intimidate]</Start> That's it? Cough up something better or perhaps you'll be my next combat trial.

<StartCheck>[Bluff]</Start> Cut the crap. I've seen how you treat the recruits. You probably scared off the last one. Now give me something to shut up or I'll tell Aribeth you're abusing your authority.
<StartCheck>[Persuade]</Start> Was there anything else you were going to give to Olgerd, Sir?
